accounted for at fair value
 which is defined as the price that would be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer a liability
in an orderly transaction between market participants at the measurement date. The following fair value hierarchy prioritizes the
inputs used to measure fair value:


in active markets for identical assets or liabilities as of the reporting date. Active markets are those in which transactions
for the asset or liability occur in sufficient frequency and volume to provide pricing information on an ongoing basis.


quoted prices in active markets included in Level 1
 which are either directly or indirectly observable as of the reporting date.
Level 2 includes those financial instruments that are valued using models or other valuation methodologies.


inputs that are generally less observable from objective sources. These inputs may be used with internally developed methodologies
that result in management&rsquo;s best estimate of fair value from the perspective of a market participant.


cash and financial assets that are measured at fair value on a recurring basis for each of the hierarchy levels (in thousands):

 2017
 the President of the
United States signed into law the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act (the &ldquo;Act&rdquo;). The Act amends the Internal Revenue Code to reduce
tax rates and modify policies
 credits
 and deductions for individuals and businesses. For businesses
 the Act reduces the corporate
federal tax rate from a maximum of 35% to a flat 21% rate. The rate reduction took effect on January 1
 2018. As a result of the
reduction in the corporate income tax rate from 35% to 21% under the Act
 the Company revalued its net deferred tax liability resulting
in a reduction of approximately $426 thousand
 which had been recorded as a reduction of income tax expense in the Company&rsquo;s
consolidated statements of income for the year ended December 31
 2017. The impact to the Company&rsquo;s earnings per common share
was an increase of approximately $0.04 per share. The Company&rsquo;s revaluation of its deferred tax liability is subject to further
clarification of the Act.


 the 2017 effective tax rate was
impacted by the excess tax benefit from share-based compensation activity which is reflected as a reduction of the provision for
income taxes
 where as they were previously recognized in equity. In 2017
 the effective tax rate was not impacted by the Company&rsquo;s
new state jobs credits and research &amp; development credits.


impacted by the Company&rsquo;s extensive state income tax planning.&nbsp; This planning includes taking advantage of Maryland&rsquo;s
apportionment methodology.&nbsp; As a manufacturing entity based in Maryland
 the Company utilizes the single sales factor apportionment
method in addition to claiming new state jobs credits and research &amp; development credits.&nbsp; The Company has separate company
state net operating loss carry forwards totaling $22.0 million that start expiring in 2029.&nbsp;


    
    








 2017
 the Company
leases office space for corporate offices
 a distribution facility in Texas
 a raw materials warehouse in Maryland under leasing
terms ranging from 5 to 9 years. The Company has 4 previously corporate-operated MWCC Centers that were sold to franchises and
subleased which expire within 2 years.

16. DISCONTINUED OPERATIONS
 EXIT ACTIVITIES
AND CLINIC OBLIGATIONS


 the Company exited the Medifast Weight
Control corporate center model by selling 41 company owned centers to existing franchise partners (24 centers were sold in June
2014 and the remaining 17 centers were sold in December 2014) and closure of the remaining 34 corporate centers. In accordance
with ASU 2014-08

 and Equipment (Topic 360): Reporting
Discontinued Operations and Disclosures of Disposals of Components of an Entity
 liabilities
 operating results
and cash flows of the corporate Medifast Weight Control Center business unit have been presented separately as discontinued operations
in the Consolidated Financial Statements for all periods presented.

		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;Accounts Receivable and Allowance for Sales Returns and Doubtful Accounts - &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Accounts receivable are recorded net of reserves for sales returns and allowances
 and net of provisions for doubtful accounts.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;We review the reserves for customer returns at each reporting period and adjust them to reflect data available at that time. To estimate reserves for returns
 we consider actual return rates in preceding periods. To the extent the estimate of returns changes
 we will adjust the reserve
 which will impact the amount of product sales revenue recognized in the period of the adjustment. Our estimates for returns have not differed materially from our actual returns. The provision for estimated returns as of December 31
 2017 and 2016 was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$557&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; thousand and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$394&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; thousand
 respectively.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Allowances for doubtful accounts are based primarily on an analysis of aged accounts receivable balances and the credit worthiness of our customers as determined by credit checks and analysis
 as well as customer payment history.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The allowance for doubtful accounts as of December 31
 2017 and 2016 was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$40 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;thousand and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$55&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; thousand
 respectively.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;Clinic Closure Costs&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;- Clinic closure costs are expensed and recognized as a liability at their fair value when incurred.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;One-time employee severance costs are expensed and recognized as a liability when the plan is finalized by management
 approved and committed to by management
 and communicated to the employee.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Contractual costs that will continue to be incurred (operating leases) are recognized at the cease use date.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The fair value of operating lease contracts is determined based on the present value of the remaining lease payments.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Other costs associated with closing the clinic or relocating employees are expensed as incurred.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Property
 plant and equipment are stated at cost less accumulated depreciation and amortization. The Company computes depreciation and amortization using the straight-line method over the estimated useful lives of the assets acquired as follows:&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Courier New;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 1pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:1pt;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;div style=width:100%&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=border-collapse:collapse;width: 100.00%;margin-left:0pt;&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:62.48%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size: 1pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:1pt;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:04.62%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;

				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;

						&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;&gt;Building and building improvements&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:04.62%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.75pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:03.98%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.75pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;

		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;a name=_contentSection_38f8cbaa_b9e9_4021_8daa_&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;5.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;ACCOUNTS PAYABLE AND ACCRUED EXPENSES&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt 0pt;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Courier New;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;&gt;Accounts payable and accrued expenses consisted of the following (in thousands):&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Courier New;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 1pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:1pt;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;div style=width:100%&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=border-collapse:collapse;width: 100.00%;margin-left:0pt;&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:36.80%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size: 1pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:1pt;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

 respectively.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;12. ASSET IMPAIRMENT&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;During the second quarter of 2016
 the Company incurred a &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$6.1&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million impairment charge in connection with the abandonment of software under development for the &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;OPTA&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;VIA business unit.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The decision to abandon the software
 which was determined in the final stages of the quarterly close process
 was the result of an in depth analysis of proven alternatives available today in the market which are a better fit for our business going forward and the cost of these alternatives when compared to the ongoing development and maintenance of the abandoned software.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The impairment charge was recorded for the full value of the asset and has been included as part of selling
 general
 and administrative expense on the consolidated statements of income.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Courier New;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:bold;font-size:9pt;&gt;1.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;NATURE OF THE BUSINESS&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Courier New;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;&gt;Medifast
 Inc. (the &amp;#x201C;Company&amp;#x201D; or &amp;#x201C;Medifast&amp;#x201D;) is a Delaware corporation
 incorporated in 1989. The Company&amp;#x2019;s operations are primarily conducted through its wholly owned subsidiaries
 Jason Pharmaceuticals
 Inc.

 LLC
 Jason Enterprises
 Inc.
 Jason Properties
 LLC
 Medifast Franchise Systems
 Inc.
 Medifast Nutrition
 Inc.
 Seven Crondall Associates
 LLC
 Performance Products
 LLC
 and Corporate Events
 Inc.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Company is a leading manufacturer and distributor of clinically proven healthy living products and programs.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Company&amp;#x2019;s product lines include weight loss
 weight management and healthy living meal replacements
 snacks
 hydration products
 and vitamins.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Company has one modern
 United States Food and Drug Administration (&amp;#x201C;FDA&amp;#x201D;)-approved manufacturing facility located in Owings Mills
 Maryland.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Courier New;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;&gt;These products are sold through various means
 including the internet
 call center
 independent health advisors
 medical professionals
 franchise weight loss clinics
 and direct consumer marketing supported via the phone and internet.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The processing
 formulation
 packaging
 labeling and advertising of the Company&amp;#x2019;s products are subject to regulation by one or more federal agencies
 including the FDA
 the Federal Trade Commission (the &amp;#x201C;FTC&amp;#x201D;)
 the Consumer Product Safety Commission
 the United States Department of Agriculture
 and the United States Environmental Protection Agency.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Courier New;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;

 institutional money funds and other short-term investments with a maturity of 90 days or less at the time of purchase. &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt 0pt;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;a name=_contentSection_39357634_be77_4b84_937a_&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;15.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;COMMITMENTS&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;Operating Leases:&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 18pt 6pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;As of December 31
 2017
 the Company leases office space for corporate offices
 a distribution facility in Texas
 a raw materials warehouse in Maryland under leasing terms ranging from &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;5&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;9&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; years.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Company has &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;4&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; previously corporate-operated MWCC Centers that were sold to franchises and subleased which expire within &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;2&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; years.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 18pt 6pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Future minimum rental and lease payments required under non-cancelable original lease terms in excess of one year as of December 31
 2017 (in thousands):&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt 18pt 0pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 1pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:1pt;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;

		&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt 0pt;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Courier New;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Courier New;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;&gt;For the year ended December 31
 2015
 the positive impact to rent expense was due to lease termination agreements that resulted in the reversal of rent obligations estimates that were expensed in 2014.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Equipment lease expense for continuing operations for the years ended December 31
 2017
 2016
 and 2015 was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$0.2&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$0.7&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million
 and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$1.0&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million
 respectively.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;Unconditional purchase obligations:&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;At December 31
 2017
 the Company had &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$8.5&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million in unconditional purchase obligations for inventory.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;

		&lt;/p&gt;

				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:21.98%;border-top:1pt solid #000000 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:2pt double #000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.00pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;text-align:right; nowrap=nowrap&gt;(165)
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
		&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt 0pt 0pt 13.5pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 1pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:1pt;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;


		&lt;p style=margin:4.5pt 0pt 6pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;Comprehensive Income - &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Other comprehensive income refers to revenues
 expenses
 gains and losses that are not included in net income but rather are recorded directly in stockholders&amp;#x2019; equity. Comprehensive income consists of net income
 unrealized gains and losses on available-for-sale securities
 and foreign currency translation adjustments.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;


		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Courier New;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;

 and the balances with these financial institutions often exceed the amount of insurance provided on such accounts by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation. The cash and cash equivalents generally are maintained with financial institutions with reputable credit
 and therefore bear minimal credit risk. Historically
 we have not experienced any losses due to such concentration of credit risk. &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;a name=_contentSection_18e875de_d3c4_4b0a_8596_&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;8.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;SHARED-BASED COMPENSATION&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Stock Options:&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;The Company has issued non-qualified and incentive stock options to employees and nonemployee directors.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The fair value of these options are estimated on the date of grant using the Black-Scholes option pricing model
 which requires estimates of the expected term of the option
 the risk-free interest rate
 the expected volatility of the price of the Company&amp;#x2019;s common stock
 and dividend yield.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Options outstanding as of December 31
 2017 generally vest over a period of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;three&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; years with an expiration term of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;ten&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; years.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The exercise price of these options ranges from &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$24.26&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$44&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;.73&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Due to the Company&amp;#x2019;s lack of option exercise history
 the expected term is calculated using the simplified method defined as the midpoint between the vesting period and the contractual term of each option.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The risk free interest rate is based on the United States Treasury yield curve in effect on the date of grant that most closely corresponds to the expected term of the option.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The expected volatility is based on the historical volatility of the Company&amp;#x2019;s common stock over the period of time equivalent to the expected term for each award. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;The dividend yield is computed as the annualized dividend rate at the grant divided by the strike price of the stock option.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The weighted average input assumptions used for the years ended December 31
 2017
 2016 and 2015 were as follows:&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 1pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:1pt;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;div style=width:100%&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=border-collapse:collapse;width: 100.00%;margin-left:0pt;&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;

					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size: 1pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:1pt;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:22.22%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.00pt;color:#000000;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;text-align:right; nowrap=nowrap&gt;42.22%&amp;nbsp;

		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;As of December 31
 2017
 the weighted-average remaining contractual life was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;7.64&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; years with an aggregate intrinsic value of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$4.1&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million for outstanding stock options and the weighted-average remaining contractual life was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;6.96&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; years with an aggregate intrinsic value of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$2.2&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million for exercisable options.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The weighted-average grant date fair value of options granted during the year ended December 31
 2017 and 2016 were &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$13.73&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$7.91&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 respectively.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The unrecognized compensation expense calculated under the fair value method for shares expected to vest as of December 31
 2017 was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;307&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; thousand and is expected to be recognized over a weighted average period of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;1.66&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; years.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Company received &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;568&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; thousand and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$2&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;99&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; thousand in cash proceeds from the exercise of stock options during the years ended December 31
 2017 and 2016
 respectively.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The total intrinsic value of options exercised during the years ended December 31
 2017 and 2016 was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$603&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; thousand and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$69&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; thousand
 respectively.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Restricted Stock:&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;The Company has issued restricted stock to employees and nonemployee directors generally with vesting terms up to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;five&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; years after the date of grant.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The fair value is equal to the market price of the Company&amp;#x2019;s common stock on the date of grant.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Expense for restricted stock is amortized ratably over the vesting period.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;A summary of outstanding restricted stock and award activity as of December 31
 2017 and 2016 are as follows:&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 1pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:1pt;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;

			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;The total fair value of restricted stock awards vested during the years ended December 31
 2017
 2016
 and 2015 were &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$6.8&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million

 and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$3.9&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million
 respectively.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;The total share-based compensation charged against income during the years ended December 31
 2017
 2016
 and 2015 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;4.3&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;3.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;4&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million
 and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$3.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;1&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million
 respectively.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Included in share-based compensation for the year ended December 31
 2017 was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$856&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; thousand in expense for &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;273
300&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; shares that will vest if certain market and performance conditions are achieved.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Included in share-based compensation for the year ended December 31
 2016 is &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$0.8&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million for &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;59
375&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; shares of performance awards issuable to certain key employees that vested on December 31
 2017 based on achieving the 2016 financial plan. Also included in the 2016 expense
 is &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$0.2&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million in expense for &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;210
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; shares that will vest if certain market and performance conditions are achieved.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The grant date fair value of the market and performance awards based on the Monte Carlo Method are &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$0.9&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$2.0&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million for the years ended December 31
 2017 and 2016
 respectively
 which will be recognized evenly through &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;December 2019&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;The total income tax benefit recognized in the consolidated statements of income for restricted stock awards was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;2.1&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$1.2&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;1.0&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million for the years ended December 31
 2017
 2016
 and 2015
 respectively.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The excess tax benefits from share-based compensation recognized in additional paid-in capital for the years ended December 31
 2016 and 2015 was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$23&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;0&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; thousand and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$2&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;4&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;7&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; thousand
 respectively.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;There was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$2.0&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million of total unrecognized compensation cost related to restricted stock awards as of December 31
 2017
 which is expected to be recognized over a weighted-average period of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;1.63&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; years.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;There was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$1.8&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million of unrecognized compensation cost related to the &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;273
300&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; market and performance award shares discussed above as of December 31
 2017
 which is expected to be recognized over a weighted-average period of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;2.00&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; years.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt 0pt;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Courier New;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;a name=_contentSection_65388f01_b3a2_4220_badd_&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:bold;font-size:9pt;&gt;16. DISCONTINUED OPERATIONS
 EXIT ACTIVITIES
 AND CLINIC OBLIGATIONS&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Courier New;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;&gt;In 2014

 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:italic;font-size:9pt;&gt;Presentation of Financial Statements (Topic 205) and Property Plant
 and Equipment (Topic 360): Reporting Discontinued Operations and Disclosures of Disposals of Components of an Entity&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;&gt; the assets
 liabilities
 operating results
 and cash flows of the corporate Medifast Weight Control Center business unit have been presented separately as discontinued operations in the Consolidated Financial Statements for all periods presented.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Courier New;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;

		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 1pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:1pt;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;

		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:4.5pt 0pt 6pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;Earnings Per Share &amp;#x2013; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Basic earnings per share computations are calculated utilizing the weighted average number of shares of common stock outstanding during the periods presented.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Diluted EPS is calculated utilizing the weighted average number of shares of common stock outstanding adjusted for the effect of dilutive common stock equivalents.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;


		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;a name=_contentSection_c9803f40_f8b1_4ebf_a05c_&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;6.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;EARNINGS PER SHARE&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Basic earnings per share (&amp;#x201C;EPS&amp;#x201D;) computations are calculated utilizing the weighted average number of shares of common stock outstanding during the periods presented.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Diluted EPS is calculated utilizing the weighted average number of shares of common stock outstanding adjusted for the effect of dilutive common stock equivalents.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;;font-size: 9pt&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;The following table sets forth the computation of basic and diluted EPS for the years ended December 31
 2017
 2016 and 2015 (in thousands
 except per share data):&lt;/font&gt;

						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:02.24%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:16.22%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;text-align:right;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; &amp;nbsp;-&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:01.18%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;

					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:16.22%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;text-align:right;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; &amp;nbsp;-&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:01.18%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;

					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:16.18%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.00pt;color:#000000;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;text-align:right; nowrap=nowrap&gt;0.04&amp;nbsp;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:37.60%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt 0.05pt 6pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;Total diluted earnings per share&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:04.70%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt 0.05pt 6pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:02.24%;border-top:1pt solid #000000 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:2pt double #000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:16.22%;border-top:1pt solid #000000 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:2pt double #000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.00pt;color:#000000;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;text-align:right; nowrap=nowrap&gt;2.29&amp;nbsp;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:01.18%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;text-align:center;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:02.24%;border-top:1pt solid #000000 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:2pt double #000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:16.22%;border-top:1pt solid #000000 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:2pt double #000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.00pt;color:#000000;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;text-align:right; nowrap=nowrap&gt;1.49&amp;nbsp;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:01.18%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:02.24%;border-top:1pt solid #000000 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:2pt double #000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:16.18%;border-top:1pt solid #000000 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:2pt double #000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.00pt;color:#000000;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;text-align:right; nowrap=nowrap&gt;1.66&amp;nbsp;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
		&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:4.5pt 0pt 6pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;The calculation of diluted earnings per share excluded &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;3
125&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 &amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;35
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;69
375&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; antidilutive options outstanding for the years ended December 31
 2017
 2016
 and 2015 respectively.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The calculation of diluted earnings per share for the year ended December 31
 2016 also excluded &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;93&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; antidilutive restricted stock awards.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Courier New;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;

 investment in available-for-sale securities
 and trade receivables. The carrying amounts of cash and cash equivalents
 and trade receivables approximate fair value due to their short maturities. The fair values of investment in available-for-sale securities are based on dealer quotes.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;


		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;10.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;FINANCIAL INSTRUMENTS&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Certain financial assets and liabilities are accounted for at fair value
 which is defined as the price that would be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly transaction between market participants at the measurement date. The following fair value hierarchy prioritizes the inputs used to measure fair value: &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Level 1 &amp;#x2013; Quoted prices are available in active markets for identical assets or liabilities as of the reporting date. Active markets are those in which transactions for the asset or liability occur in sufficient frequency and volume to provide pricing information on an ongoing basis. &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Level 2 &amp;#x2013; Pricing inputs are other than quoted prices in active markets included in Level 1
 which are either directly or indirectly observable as of the reporting date. Level 2 includes those financial instruments that are valued using models or other valuation methodologies. &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Level 3 &amp;#x2013; Pricing inputs include significant inputs that are generally less observable from objective sources. These inputs may be used with internally developed methodologies that result in management&amp;#x2019;s best estimate of fair value from the perspective of a market participant.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;The following tables present the Company&amp;#x2019;s cash and financial assets that are measured at fair value on a recurring basis for each of the hierarchy levels (in thousands):&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 1pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:1pt;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;div style=width:100%&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=border-collapse:collapse;width: 100.00%;margin-left:0pt;&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:23.00%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size: 1pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:1pt;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:01.12%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:02.34%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:09.28%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:01.24%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:02.34%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:09.28%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:01.24%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:02.34%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:09.28%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:01.24%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:02.34%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:09.28%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;

		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;The Company had realized loss of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;82&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; thousand for the year ended December 31
 2017 and realized gains of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$118&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; thousand and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$526&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; thousand for the years ended December 31
 2016 and 2015
 respectively.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;As of December 31
 2017
 2016
 and 2015
 gross unrealized losses and gains related to individual securities that had been in a continuous loss or gain position for 12 months or longer were not significant.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The maturities of the Company&amp;#x2019;s investment securities generally range up to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;5&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; years for municipal bonds and for government and agency securities.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;Long-lived Fixed Asset Impairment - &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Long-lived assets are reviewed for impairment whenever events or changes in circumstances indicate that the carrying amount of an asset may not be recoverable. Recoverability of assets to be held and used is measured by a comparison of the carrying amount of an asset to estimated undiscounted future cash flows expected to be generated by the asset. If the carrying amount of an asset exceeds its estimated future cash flows
 an impairment charge is recognized by the amount by which the carrying amount of the asset exceeds the fair value of the asset&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt 0pt;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Courier New;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;a name=_contentSection_32856677_eea5_4093_a263_&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:bold;font-size:9pt;&gt;14. INCOME TAXES&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Courier New;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;&gt;Income tax expense attributable to continuing operations for the years ended December 31
 2017
 2016
 and 2015 consisted of the following (in thousands):&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;text-align:left;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Courier New;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 1pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:1pt;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;div style=width:100%&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=border-collapse:collapse;width: 100.00%;margin-left:0pt;&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:44.04%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size: 1pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:1pt;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;

				&lt;/td&gt;

					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;

		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Courier New;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;&gt;On December 22
 2017
 the President of the United States signed into law the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act (the &amp;#x201C;Act&amp;#x201D;). The Act amends the Internal Revenue Code to reduce tax rates and modify policies
 credits
 and deductions for individuals and businesses. For businesses
 the Act reduces the corporate federal tax rate from a maximum of 35% to a flat 21% rate. The rate reduction took effect on January 1


 which had been recorded as a reduction of income tax expense in the Company&amp;#x2019;s consolidated statements of income for the year ended December 31

		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Courier New;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;&gt;In addition
 the 2017 effective tax rate was impacted by the excess tax benefit from share-based compensation activity which is reflected as a reduction of the provision for income taxes
 where as they were previously recognized in equity. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;&gt;In 2017
 the effective tax rate was not impacted by the Company&amp;#x2019;s &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;&gt;new state jobs credits and research &amp;amp; development credits.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Courier New;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;&gt;In 2016 and 2015 effective tax rates were impacted by the Company&amp;#x2019;s extensive state income tax planning.&amp;nbsp; This planning includes taking advantage of Maryland&amp;#x2019;s apportionment methodology.&amp;nbsp; As a manufacturing entity based in Maryland

		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Courier New;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Courier New;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Courier New;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Courier New;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Courier New;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Courier New;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;

 based on all available evidence
 management believes it is more-likely-than-not that the position will be sustained upon examination
 including the resolution of appeals or litigation processes
 if any. Tax positions taken are not offset or aggregated with other positions. Tax positions that meet the more-likely-than-not recognition threshold are measured as the largest amount of tax benefit that is more than 50 percent likely of being realized upon settlement with the applicable taxing authority. The portion of the benefits associated with tax positions taken that exceeds the amount measured as described above is reflected as a liability for unrecognized tax benefits in the accompanying consolidated balance sheets along with any associated interest and penalties that would be payable to the taxing authorities upon examination.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Courier New;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;&gt;We evaluated our tax positions and determined that we did not have any material uncertain tax positions. Our policy is to recognize interest and penalties accrued on uncertain tax positions as part of income tax expense. For the years ending December 31
 2017 and 2016
 no material estimated interest or penalties were recognized for the uncertainty of certain tax positions. We file income tax returns in the United States
 Canada and various states jurisdictions.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;We are generally no longer subject to United States federal
 state
 and local income tax examinations by tax authorities for the years before 2014.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Courier New;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;&gt;Deferred tax assets are recognized for deductible temporary differences and deferred tax liabilities are recognized for taxable temporary differences. Temporary differences are the differences between the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and their tax bases. Deferred tax assets are reduced by a valuation allowance when
 in the opinion of management
 it is more likely than not that some portion or all of the deferred tax assets will not be realized. Deferred tax assets and liabilities are adjusted for the effects of changes in tax laws and rates on the date of enactment.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;a name=_contentSection_73b6ddec_8428_4788_899d_&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;3.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;INVENTORIES&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Inventories consist principally of packaged meal replacements held in the Company&amp;#x2019;s warehouses.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Inventory is stated at the lower of cost or net realizable value
 utilizing the first-in
 first-out method.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The cost of finished goods includes the cost of raw materials
 packaging supplies
 direct and indirect labor and other indirect manufacturing costs.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;On a quarterly basis
 management reviews inventory for unsalable or obsolete inventory.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Inventories consisted of the following (in thousands):&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt 0pt 13.5pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 1pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:1pt;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;

						&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:1pt;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;

					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
