				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:03.14%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:03.74%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:27.10%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.00pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;text-align:right; nowrap=nowrap&gt;(826)
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:32.22%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt 0.05pt 6pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Total&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:02.94%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:03.74%;border-top:1pt solid #000000 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:2pt double #000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:27.12%;border-top:1pt solid #000000 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:2pt double #000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.00pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;text-align:right; nowrap=nowrap&gt;19
328&amp;nbsp;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:03.14%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:03.74%;border-top:1pt solid #000000 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:2pt double #000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:27.10%;border-top:1pt solid #000000 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:2pt double #000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.00pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;text-align:right; nowrap=nowrap&gt;18
311&amp;nbsp;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
		&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 1pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:1pt;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;Inventory - &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Inventories consist principally of packaged meal replacements held in the Company&amp;#x2019;s warehouses.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Inventory is stated at the lower of cost or net realizable value
 utilizing the first-in
 first-out method.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The cost of finished goods includes the cost of raw materials
 packaging supplies
 direct and indirect labor and other indirect manufacturing costs.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;On a quarterly basis
 management reviews inventory for unsalable or obsolete inventory.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;Investment Securities &amp;#x2013;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;The Company&amp;#x2019;s investments consist of debt and equity securities classified as available-for-sale securities.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Available-for-sale securities are stated at fair value
 and unrealized holding gains and losses
 net of the related deferred tax effect
 are reported as a separate component of accumulated other comprehensive income (loss) in stockholders' equity.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Interest and dividends on marketable debt and equity securities are recognized in income when declared. Realized gains and losses
 including losses from declines in value of specific securities determined by management to be other-than-temporary
 if any
 are included in income. &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;


		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;Operating Leases -&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; Medifast&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; leases retail stores
 distribution facilities
 and office space under operating leases.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Many of our lease agreements contain tenant improvement allowances
 rent holidays
 rent escalation clauses
 and contingent rent provisions.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Company recognizes incentives and minimum rental expenses on a straight-line basis over the terms of the leases.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;We commence recording rent expense on the date of initial possession
 which is generally when we enter the space and begin to make improvements to properties for our intended use.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;For tenant improvement allowances and rent holidays
 we record a deferred rent liability on the consolidated balance sheets and amortize the deferred rent over the terms of the leases as reductions to rent expense on the consolidated statements of income.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;For scheduled rent escalation clauses during the lease terms or for rental payments commencing at a date other than the date of initial occupancy
 we record minimum rental expenses on a straight-line basis over the terms of the leases on the consolidated statements of income.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Several leases provide for contingent rents
 which are determined as a percentage of gross sales in excess of specified levels.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;We record a contingent rent liability on the consolidated balance sheets and the corresponding rent expense when we determine achieving the specified levels is probable.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Courier New;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:bold;font-size:9pt;&gt;Accounting Pronouncements - Adopted in 2017&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;In March 2016
 the Financial Accounting Standards Board (the &amp;#x201C;FASB&amp;#x201D;) issued Accounting Standards Update (&amp;#x201C;ASU&amp;#x201D;) 2016-09
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-style:italic;&gt;Compensation- Stock Compensation (Topic 718): Improvements to Employee Share-Based Payable Accounting.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; &amp;nbsp;The objective of this update is to simplify several aspects of the accounting for employee share-based payment transactions
 including the income tax consequences
 classifications of awards as either equity or liabilities
 and the classification on the statement of cash flow.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The new guidance requires
 among its other provisions
 that excess tax benefits (which represent the excess of actual tax benefits received at the date of vesting or settlement over the benefits recognized over the vesting period or upon issuance of share-based payments) and tax deficiencies (which represent the amount by which actual tax benefits received at the date of vesting or settlement is lower than the benefits recognized over the vesting period or upon issuance of share-based payments) be recorded in the statement of income as an increase or decrease in income taxes when the awards vest or are settled. This is in comparison to the prior requirement that these excess tax benefits be recognized in additional paid-in capital and these tax deficiencies be recognized either as an offset to accumulated excess tax benefits
 if any
 or in the statement of income. The new guidance also requires excess tax benefits to be classified along with other income tax cash flows as an operating activity in the statements of cash flows rather than
 as previously required
 a financing activity.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The pronouncement is effective for fiscal years beginning after December 15
 2016
 including interim periods.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;As such
 the Company adopted this new accounting pronouncement effective January 1
 2017.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;As a result of this adoption:&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;div style=width:100%&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=border-collapse:collapse;width: 100.00%;margin-left:0pt;&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:504.00pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
			&lt;p style=text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size: 9pt;margin:0pt;&gt;
				&lt;font style=margin:0pt 0pt 8pt;width: 36pt;font-family:Symbol;text-align:left;text-justify:inter-ideograph;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:9pt;;&gt; &amp;#xB7;&lt;/font&gt;
			&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;s of cash flows for the year ended December 31
 2017
 where these benefits are classified along with other income tax cash flows as an operating activity.&lt;/font&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
			&lt;p style=text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size: 9pt;margin:0pt;&gt;
			&amp;nbsp;	&lt;font style=margin:0pt 0pt 8pt;width: 36pt;font-family:Symbol;text-align:left;text-justify:inter-ideograph;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:9pt;;&gt; &amp;#xB7;&lt;/font&gt;
			&lt;/p&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
			&lt;p style=text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size: 9pt;margin:0pt;&gt;
			&amp;nbsp;	&lt;font style=margin:0pt 0pt 8pt;width: 36pt;font-family:Symbol;text-align:left;text-justify:inter-ideograph;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:9pt;;&gt; &amp;#xB7;&lt;/font&gt;
			&lt;/p&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
			&lt;p style=text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size: 9pt;margin:0pt;&gt;
			&amp;nbsp;	&lt;font style=margin:0pt 0pt 8pt;width: 36pt;font-family:Symbol;text-align:left;text-justify:inter-ideograph;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:9pt;;&gt; &amp;#xB7;&lt;/font&gt;
			&lt;/p&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:504.00pt;height:27.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
			&lt;p style=text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt;margin:0pt;&gt;
				&lt;font style=margin:0pt 0pt 8pt;width: 36pt;font-family:Symbol;text-align:left;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size:9pt;;&gt; &amp;#xB7;&lt;/font&gt;
			&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;We recognized a discrete tax benefit of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$1.2&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; million in the provision for income taxes line item of our consolidated statements of income for year ended December 31
 2017 related to excess tax benefits upon vesting or settlement in that period. &lt;/font&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;overflow: hidden;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
			&lt;p style=text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt;margin:0pt;&gt;
				&lt;font style=margin:0pt 0pt 8pt;width: 36pt;font-family:Symbol;text-align:left;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size:9pt;;&gt; &amp;#xB7;&lt;/font&gt;
			&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;We elected to adopt the cash flow presentation of the excess tax benefits prospectively
 commencing with our consolidated statements of cash flows for the year ended December 31
 2017
 where these benefits are classified along with other income tax cash flows as an operating activity.&lt;/font&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;overflow: hidden;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
			&lt;p style=text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt;margin:0pt;&gt;
				&lt;font style=margin:0pt 0pt 8pt;width: 36pt;font-family:Symbol;text-align:left;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size:9pt;;&gt; &amp;#xB7;&lt;/font&gt;
			&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;We elected to account for forfeitures as they occur to determine the amount of compensation cost to be recognized in each period
 rather than estimating the number of share-based awards expected to vest. &lt;/font&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;overflow: hidden;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
			&lt;p style=text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt;margin:0pt;&gt;
				&lt;font style=margin:0pt 0pt 8pt;width: 36pt;font-family:Symbol;text-align:left;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size:9pt;;&gt; &amp;#xB7;&lt;/font&gt;
			&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;At this time
 we have not changed our policy on statutory withholding requirements and will continue to allow an employee to withhold at the minimum statutory withholding requirements. Amounts paid by us to taxing authorities when directly withholding shares associated with employees&amp;#x2019; income tax withholding obligations are classified as a financing activity in our consolidated statements of cash flows for the years ended December 31
 2017
 2016 and 2015
 respectively. &lt;/font&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;overflow: hidden;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
			&lt;p style=text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt;margin:0pt;&gt;
				&lt;font style=margin:0pt 0pt 8pt;width: 36pt;font-family:Symbol;text-align:left;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size:9pt;;&gt; &amp;#xB7;&lt;/font&gt;
			&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;We excluded the excess tax benefits from the assumed proceeds available to repurchase shares in the computation of our diluted earnings per share for the year ended December 31
 2017.&lt;/font&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
		&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;In July 2015
 the FASB issued ASU 2015-11
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-style:italic;color:#000000;&gt;Inventory (Topic 330): Simplifying the Measurement of Inventory&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;This pronouncement changes the measurement principle for certain methods from the lower of cost or net realizable value to the lower of cost and net realizable value.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Net realizable value is defined as the estimated selling price in the ordinary course of business
 less reasonably predictable costs of completion
 disposal and transportation. ASU 2015-11 does not apply to inventory that is measured using the Last-in First-out or the retail inventory method.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The pronouncement is effective for fiscal years beginning after December 15
 2016
 including interim periods within those fiscal years.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The adoption of this new accounting pronouncement did not have a material impact on our financial statements.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;In August 2014
 the FASB issued ASU 2014-15
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-style:italic;color:#000000;&gt;Presentation of Financial Statements &amp;#x2013; Going Concern (Subtopic 205-40): Disclosure of Uncertainties about an Entity&amp;#x2019;s Ability to Continue as a Going Concern
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; which requires management of a company to evaluate whether there is substantial doubt about the company&amp;#x2019;s ability to continue as a going concern. The pronouncement is effective for fiscal years ending after December 15
 2016
 and for interim and annual reporting periods thereafter
 with early adoption permitted.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Company adopted this standard and it had no material impact on the Company&amp;#x2019;s financial statements.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Courier New;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:bold;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Courier New;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:bold;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;&gt;Recently Issued Accounting Pronouncements &amp;#x2013; Pending Adoption&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;We have considered all new accounting pronouncements and have concluded that there are no new pronouncements that may have a material impact on our results of operations
 financial condition
 or cash flows
 based on current information
 except for:&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;In February 2016
 the FASB issued ASU 2016-02
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-style:italic;color:#000000;&gt;Leases (Topic 842)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The objective of this update is to increase transparency and comparability among organizations by recognizing the rights and obligations of all leased assets with a term greater than 12 months to be presented on the balance sheet.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The pronouncement is effective for fiscal years beginning after December 15
 2018
 including interim periods within those annual periods and is to be applied utilizing a modified retrospective approach.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Management is currently evaluating the effect that the provisions of ASU 2016-02 will have on the Company&amp;#x2019;s financial statements.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;In January 2016
 the FASB issued ASU 2016-01
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-style:italic;color:#000000;&gt;Financial Instruments- Overall (Subtopic 825-10): Recognition and Measurement of Financial Assets and Financial Liabilities&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The main objective of this update is to enhance the reporting model for financial instruments to provide users of financial statements with more decision-useful information.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The new guidance addresses certain aspects of recognition
 measurement
 presentation
 and disclosure of financial instruments. Most notably ASU 2016-01 requires the change in fair value of available for sale securities to be recognized in net income.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The pronouncement also requires the use of the exit price notion
 the separate presentation of financial assets and liabilities by measurement category and form of asset
 and the separate presentation in other comprehensive income of changes in fair value resulting from a change in the instrument-specific credit risk.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The pronouncement is effective for fiscal years beginning after December 15
 2017
 including interim periods within those fiscal years.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Based on the risk level of the Company&amp;#x2019;s investment portfolio
 management does not expect the pronouncement to have a material impact on the Company&amp;#x2019;s financial statements.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;As of December 31
 2017
 the Company&amp;#x2019;s unrealized losses on marketable securities
 net of tax included in accumulated other comprehensive loss of the Company&amp;#x2019;s Consolidated Balance Sheets was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$160&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; thousand.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;In May 2014
 the FASB issued ASU 2015-09
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-style:italic;color:#000000;&gt;Revenue from Contracts with Customers (Topic 606).&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;The new revenue recognition standard requires the Company to recognize revenue for the transfer of goods or services to customers for the amount the Company expects to be entitled to receive in exchange for those goods or services.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Company will be required to identify the contract
 identify the relevant performance obligations
 determine the transaction price
 allocate the transaction price to the performance obligations in the contract
 and recognize the revenue when the entity satisfies a performance obligation. The new revenue standard is effective for annual reporting periods (including interim reporting periods within those periods) beginning January 1
 2018. Companies have the option of using either a full retrospective or a modified retrospective approach to adopt the guidance. The Company intends to adopt the new standard on a modified retrospective basis.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;On January 1
 2018
 the Company adopted the new revenue standard on a modified retrospective basis and recorded an after-tax transition adjustment to reduce retained earnings as of January 1
 2018 by approximately &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$2.0&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; million.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;This is comprised of $5.6 million of revenue offset by $3.6 million of inventory costs
 deferred shipping expense
 credit card fees and income taxes.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;The results of ASU 606 primarily impact the Company&amp;#x2019;s timing of revenue recognition for product shipments
 as product revenue will be recognized upon customer receipt in lieu of at the time of shipment.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The new standard will require more extensive revenue-related disclosures.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Future minimum rental and lease payments required under non-cancelable original lease terms in excess of one year as of December 31
 2017 (in thousands):&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;

 Performance Products
 LLC
 and Corporate Events
 Inc.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;All inter-Company transactions and balances have been eliminated in consolidation. The Company&amp;#x2019;s fiscal year ends on December 31.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Depreciation and amortization expense for continuing operations for the years ended December 31
 2017
 2016 and 2015 was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$4.2 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 &amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$5.4 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$7.1 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 respectively.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;

		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;Property
 Plant
 and Equipment - &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Property
 plant and equipment are stated at cost less accumulated depreciation and amortization. The Company computes depreciation and amortization using the straight-line method over the estimated useful lives of the assets acquired as follows:&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;

				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:28.92%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.75pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;&gt;Lease term&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;&gt;The depreciation life for leasehold improvements is the lesser of the estimated useful life of the addition or the term of the related lease.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

 and equipment consisted of the following (in thousands):&lt;/font&gt;

		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Courier New;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;&gt;Earnings per share (sometimes referred to as &amp;#x201C;EPS&amp;#x201D;) is computed independently for each of the quarters presented; accordingly
 the sum of the quarterly earnings per share may not equal the total computed for the year. &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Courier New;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;

		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:12pt 0pt 6pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;Research and Development- &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;The Company incurs research and development costs in connection with the development of new products and programs
 which are expensed as incurred.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Company incurred &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$1.5&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$2.0&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million
 and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$1.8&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million in research and development expense for the years ended December 31
 2017
 2016
 and 2015
 respectively. &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;


		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;a name=_contentSection_58b6eddd_8542_47d3_9a6f_&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;11. RESTRUCTURING&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;During the first quarter of 2016
 the Company announced the departure of three Executive Vice Presidents in an effort to re-align the senior leadership team to reflect the changing needs of the business and to provide greater emphasis on the Company&amp;#x2019;s key areas of focus
 and also the resignation of the Company&amp;#x2019;s President and Chief Operating Officer.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Company incurred &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$1.2&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million in net restructuring costs in selling
 general
 and administrative expense associated with the departure of these four executives.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;This includes a &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$0.2&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million reversal of costs accrued in 2015 for deferred shares that were granted in connection with the 2015 bonus plan and were forfeited as a result of their departure.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;The following table summarizes our severance accruals
 excluding the reversal of prior year stock accrual (in thousands):&lt;/font&gt;

 promotional adjustments
 price adjustments
 and estimated returns and upon transfer of title and risk to the customer which occurs at shipping (Free On Board terms).&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Upon shipment
 the Company has no further performance obligations and collection is reasonably assured as the majority of sales are paid prior to shipping.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;

			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;&gt;The following table summarizes the exit obligations
 primarily for lease obligations related to closed corporate Medifast Weight Control Centers
 severance accruals
 and customer refunds incurred as of December 31
 2017 and 2016 (in thousands):&lt;/font&gt;

		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;&gt;The following is a summary of the Company&amp;#x2019;s operating results for discontinued operations for the year ended December 31

			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;The dividend yield is computed as the annualized dividend rate at the grant divided by the strike price of the stock option.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The weighted average input assumptions used for the years ended December 31
 2017
 2016 and 2015 were as follows:&lt;/font&gt;

				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:22.22%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;

						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
		&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;


		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;a name=_contentSection_ff35af9a_4088_45b2_a5f3_&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;13.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;BUSINESS SEGMENTS&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Operating segments are components of an enterprise about which separate financial information is available that is regularly reviewed by the chief operating decision maker about how to allocate resources and in assessing performance.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The consolidated operating profit of the Company is reviewed by the chief operating decision maker as a single segment and sales are reviewed at the business unit level.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;;font-size: 9pt&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;The following table presents sales by business units for the years ended December 31
 2017
 2016 and 2015 (in thousands):&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;

					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:01.54%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:02.94%;border-top:2pt double #000000 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:21.32%;border-top:2pt double #000000 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:01.54%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:02.94%;border-top:2pt double #000000 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:21.32%;border-top:2pt double #000000 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
		&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Courier New;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 1pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:1pt;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:4.5pt 0pt 6pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;Share-Based Compensation - &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Share-based&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; compensation consists primarily of restricted stock awards
 market- and performance-based share awards
 and stock options granted to employees and directors.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Restricted stock awards are measured at the grant date
 based on the calculated fair value of the award
 and are recognized as an expense over the requisite service period.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The fair value of the incentive stock options and non-qualified stock options is calculated using the Black-Scholes option pricing model as of the grant date and recognized over the service period.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Market and performance-based share awards that are tied to the Company&amp;#x2019;s total shareholder return and stock price are valued using the Monte Carlo method and are recognized as expense over the award&amp;#x2019;s achievement period.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Company issues new shares upon the exercise of stock options and the granting of restricted stock awards.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;Shipping and Handling Costs &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;- Our shipping and handling costs for shipments of our product to our customers are included in cost of sales. All shipping and handling charges that are billed to customers are included in net revenue. All other shipping and handling costs are included in selling
 general and administration expenses. &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Courier New;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;a name=_contentSection_f95ff9ce_2558_4c51_94ba_&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:bold;font-size:9pt;&gt;2.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING POLICIES&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Courier New;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;

 Jason Pharmaceuticals
 Inc.

 LLC
 Jason Enterprises
 Inc.
 Jason Properties
 LLC
 Medifast Franchise Systems
 Inc.
 Medifast Nutrition
 Inc.
 Seven Crondall Associates
 LLC
 Performance Products
 LLC
 and Corporate Events
 Inc.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;All inter-Company transactions and balances have been eliminated in consolidation. The Company&amp;#x2019;s fiscal year ends on December 31.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Courier New;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;

		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Courier New;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;

		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Courier New;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;

 institutional money funds and other short-term investments with a maturity of 90 days or less at the time of purchase. &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Courier New;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;

 and the balances with these financial institutions often exceed the amount of insurance provided on such accounts by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation. The cash and cash equivalents generally are maintained with financial institutions with reputable credit
 and therefore bear minimal credit risk. Historically
 we have not experienced any losses due to such concentration of credit risk. &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Courier New;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;

 investment in available-for-sale securities
 and trade receivables. The carrying amounts of cash and cash equivalents
 and trade receivables approximate fair value due to their short maturities. The fair values of investment in available-for-sale securities are based on dealer quotes.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;Accounts Receivable and Allowance for Sales Returns and Doubtful Accounts - &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Accounts receivable are recorded net of reserves for sales returns and allowances
 and net of provisions for doubtful accounts.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;We review the reserves for customer returns at each reporting period and adjust them to reflect data available at that time. To estimate reserves for returns
 we consider actual return rates in preceding periods. To the extent the estimate of returns changes
 we will adjust the reserve
 which will impact the amount of product sales revenue recognized in the period of the adjustment. Our estimates for returns have not differed materially from our actual returns. The provision for estimated returns as of December 31
 2017 and 2016 was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$557&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; thousand and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$394&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; thousand
 respectively.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Allowances for doubtful accounts are based primarily on an analysis of aged accounts receivable balances and the credit worthiness of our customers as determined by credit checks and analysis
 as well as customer payment history.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The allowance for doubtful accounts as of December 31
 2017 and 2016 was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$40 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;thousand and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$55&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; thousand
 respectively.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;Inventory - &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Inventories consist principally of packaged meal replacements held in the Company&amp;#x2019;s warehouses.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Inventory is stated at the lower of cost or net realizable value
 utilizing the first-in
 first-out method.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The cost of finished goods includes the cost of raw materials
 packaging supplies
 direct and indirect labor and other indirect manufacturing costs.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;On a quarterly basis
 management reviews inventory for unsalable or obsolete inventory.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;Investment Securities &amp;#x2013;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;The Company&amp;#x2019;s investments consist of debt and equity securities classified as available-for-sale securities.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Available-for-sale securities are stated at fair value
 and unrealized holding gains and losses
 net of the related deferred tax effect
 are reported as a separate component of accumulated other comprehensive income (loss) in stockholders' equity.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Interest and dividends on marketable debt and equity securities are recognized in income when declared. Realized gains and losses
 including losses from declines in value of specific securities determined by management to be other-than-temporary
 if any
 are included in income. &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;Property
 Plant
 and Equipment - &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Property
 plant and equipment are stated at cost less accumulated depreciation and amortization. The Company computes depreciation and amortization using the straight-line method over the estimated useful lives of the assets acquired as follows:&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Courier New;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 1pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:1pt;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;div style=width:100%&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=border-collapse:collapse;width: 100.00%;margin-left:0pt;&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:62.48%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size: 1pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;font-size:1pt;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:04.62%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;

						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;

				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;

						&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;&gt;Building and building improvements&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:04.62%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.75pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;

					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;

				&lt;/td&gt;

					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;&gt;10&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;&gt; - &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;&gt;35&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;&gt; years&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:62.48%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.75pt;padding:0pt;&gt;

				&lt;/td&gt;

					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;

					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;

				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:28.92%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.75pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;&gt;Lease term&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:62.48%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.75pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;&gt;Equipment and fixtures&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:04.62%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.75pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
