						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:03.98%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.75pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:28.92%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.75pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;&gt;3&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;&gt; - &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;&gt;15&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;&gt; years&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:62.48%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.75pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;&gt;Software&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:04.62%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.75pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=bottom style=width:03.98%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.75pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:28.92%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:12.75pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;&gt;5 years&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:62.48%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:15.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;&gt;Vehicles&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:04.62%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:15.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:03.98%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:15.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
				&lt;td valign=middle style=width:28.92%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #auto;height:15.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0.05pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 10pt&gt;
						&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;&gt;5 years&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
		&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt 0pt;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Courier New;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Courier New;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;&gt;The depreciation life for leasehold improvements is the lesser of the estimated useful life of the addition or the term of the related lease.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:12pt 0pt 6pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;Long-lived Fixed Asset Impairment - &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Long-lived assets are reviewed for impairment whenever events or changes in circumstances indicate that the carrying amount of an asset may not be recoverable. Recoverability of assets to be held and used is measured by a comparison of the carrying amount of an asset to estimated undiscounted future cash flows expected to be generated by the asset. If the carrying amount of an asset exceeds its estimated future cash flows
 an impairment charge is recognized by the amount by which the carrying amount of the asset exceeds the fair value of the asset&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;. &amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Courier New;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;

 rebates
 promotional adjustments
 price adjustments
 and estimated returns and upon transfer of title and risk to the customer which occurs at shipping (Free On Board terms).&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Upon shipment
 the Company has no further performance obligations and collection is reasonably assured as the majority of sales are paid prior to shipping.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;Shipping and Handling Costs &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;- Our shipping and handling costs for shipments of our product to our customers are included in cost of sales. All shipping and handling charges that are billed to customers are included in net revenue. All other shipping and handling costs are included in selling
 general and administration expenses. &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;Operating Leases -&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; Medifast&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; leases retail stores
 distribution facilities
 and office space under operating leases.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Many of our lease agreements contain tenant improvement allowances
 rent holidays
 rent escalation clauses
 and contingent rent provisions.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Company recognizes incentives and minimum rental expenses on a straight-line basis over the terms of the leases.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;We commence recording rent expense on the date of initial possession
 which is generally when we enter the space and begin to make improvements to properties for our intended use.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;For tenant improvement allowances and rent holidays
 we record a deferred rent liability on the consolidated balance sheets and amortize the deferred rent over the terms of the leases as reductions to rent expense on the consolidated statements of income.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;For scheduled rent escalation clauses during the lease terms or for rental payments commencing at a date other than the date of initial occupancy
 we record minimum rental expenses on a straight-line basis over the terms of the leases on the consolidated statements of income.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Several leases provide for contingent rents
 which are determined as a percentage of gross sales in excess of specified levels.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;We record a contingent rent liability on the consolidated balance sheets and the corresponding rent expense when we determine achieving the specified levels is probable.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Courier New;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;

 except for the preparation
 layout
 design and production of advertising costs which are expensed when the advertisement is first used.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Advertising expense for continuing operations
 excluding broker fees
 for the years ended December 31
 2017
 2016
 and 2015



 respectively.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:12pt 0pt 6pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;Research and Development- &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;The Company incurs research and development costs in connection with the development of new products and programs
 which are expensed as incurred.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Company incurred &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$1.5&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$2.0&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million
 and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$1.8&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; million in research and development expense for the years ended December 31
 2017
 2016
 and 2015
 respectively. &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:4.5pt 0pt 6pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;Share-Based Compensation - &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Share-based&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; compensation consists primarily of restricted stock awards
 market- and performance-based share awards
 and stock options granted to employees and directors.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Restricted stock awards are measured at the grant date
 based on the calculated fair value of the award
 and are recognized as an expense over the requisite service period.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The fair value of the incentive stock options and non-qualified stock options is calculated using the Black-Scholes option pricing model as of the grant date and recognized over the service period.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Market and performance-based share awards that are tied to the Company&amp;#x2019;s total shareholder return and stock price are valued using the Monte Carlo method and are recognized as expense over the award&amp;#x2019;s achievement period.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Company issues new shares upon the exercise of stock options and the granting of restricted stock awards.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;Clinic Closure Costs&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;- Clinic closure costs are expensed and recognized as a liability at their fair value when incurred.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;One-time employee severance costs are expensed and recognized as a liability when the plan is finalized by management
 approved and committed to by management
 and communicated to the employee.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Contractual costs that will continue to be incurred (operating leases) are recognized at the cease use date.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The fair value of operating lease contracts is determined based on the present value of the remaining lease payments.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Other costs associated with closing the clinic or relocating employees are expensed as incurred.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Courier New;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;

 based on all available evidence
 management believes it is more-likely-than-not that the position will be sustained upon examination
 including the resolution of appeals or litigation processes
 if any. Tax positions taken are not offset or aggregated with other positions. Tax positions that meet the more-likely-than-not recognition threshold are measured as the largest amount of tax benefit that is more than 50 percent likely of being realized upon settlement with the applicable taxing authority. The portion of the benefits associated with tax positions taken that exceeds the amount measured as described above is reflected as a liability for unrecognized tax benefits in the accompanying consolidated balance sheets along with any associated interest and penalties that would be payable to the taxing authorities upon examination.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Courier New;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;&gt;We evaluated our tax positions and determined that we did not have any material uncertain tax positions. Our policy is to recognize interest and penalties accrued on uncertain tax positions as part of income tax expense. For the years ending December 31
 2017 and 2016
 no material estimated interest or penalties were recognized for the uncertainty of certain tax positions. We file income tax returns in the United States
 Canada and various states jurisdictions.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;We are generally no longer subject to United States federal
 state
 and local income tax examinations by tax authorities for the years before 2014.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Courier New;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;&gt;Deferred tax assets are recognized for deductible temporary differences and deferred tax liabilities are recognized for taxable temporary differences. Temporary differences are the differences between the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and their tax bases. Deferred tax assets are reduced by a valuation allowance when
 in the opinion of management
 it is more likely than not that some portion or all of the deferred tax assets will not be realized. Deferred tax assets and liabilities are adjusted for the effects of changes in tax laws and rates on the date of enactment.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:4.5pt 0pt 6pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;Earnings Per Share &amp;#x2013; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Basic earnings per share computations are calculated utilizing the weighted average number of shares of common stock outstanding during the periods presented.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Diluted EPS is calculated utilizing the weighted average number of shares of common stock outstanding adjusted for the effect of dilutive common stock equivalents.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:4.5pt 0pt 6pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;Comprehensive Income - &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;Other comprehensive income refers to revenues
 expenses
 gains and losses that are not included in net income but rather are recorded directly in stockholders&amp;#x2019; equity. Comprehensive income consists of net income
 unrealized gains and losses on available-for-sale securities
 and foreign currency translation adjustments.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Courier New;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:bold;font-size:9pt;&gt;Accounting Pronouncements - Adopted in 2017&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;In March 2016
 the Financial Accounting Standards Board (the &amp;#x201C;FASB&amp;#x201D;) issued Accounting Standards Update (&amp;#x201C;ASU&amp;#x201D;) 2016-09
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-style:italic;&gt;Compensation- Stock Compensation (Topic 718): Improvements to Employee Share-Based Payable Accounting.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; &amp;nbsp;The objective of this update is to simplify several aspects of the accounting for employee share-based payment transactions
 including the income tax consequences
 classifications of awards as either equity or liabilities
 and the classification on the statement of cash flow.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The new guidance requires
 among its other provisions
 that excess tax benefits (which represent the excess of actual tax benefits received at the date of vesting or settlement over the benefits recognized over the vesting period or upon issuance of share-based payments) and tax deficiencies (which represent the amount by which actual tax benefits received at the date of vesting or settlement is lower than the benefits recognized over the vesting period or upon issuance of share-based payments) be recorded in the statement of income as an increase or decrease in income taxes when the awards vest or are settled. This is in comparison to the prior requirement that these excess tax benefits be recognized in additional paid-in capital and these tax deficiencies be recognized either as an offset to accumulated excess tax benefits
 if any
 or in the statement of income. The new guidance also requires excess tax benefits to be classified along with other income tax cash flows as an operating activity in the statements of cash flows rather than
 as previously required
 a financing activity.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The pronouncement is effective for fiscal years beginning after December 15
 2016
 including interim periods.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;As such
 the Company adopted this new accounting pronouncement effective January 1
 2017.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;As a result of this adoption:&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;div style=width:100%&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=border-collapse:collapse;width: 100.00%;margin-left:0pt;&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:504.00pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
			&lt;p style=text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size: 9pt;margin:0pt;&gt;
				&lt;font style=margin:0pt 0pt 8pt;width: 36pt;font-family:Symbol;text-align:left;text-justify:inter-ideograph;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:9pt;;&gt; &amp;#xB7;&lt;/font&gt;
			&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;s of cash flows for the year ended December 31
 2017
 where these benefits are classified along with other income tax cash flows as an operating activity.&lt;/font&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
			&lt;p style=text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size: 9pt;margin:0pt;&gt;
			&amp;nbsp;	&lt;font style=margin:0pt 0pt 8pt;width: 36pt;font-family:Symbol;text-align:left;text-justify:inter-ideograph;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:9pt;;&gt; &amp;#xB7;&lt;/font&gt;
			&lt;/p&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
			&lt;p style=text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size: 9pt;margin:0pt;&gt;
			&amp;nbsp;	&lt;font style=margin:0pt 0pt 8pt;width: 36pt;font-family:Symbol;text-align:left;text-justify:inter-ideograph;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:9pt;;&gt; &amp;#xB7;&lt;/font&gt;
			&lt;/p&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
			&lt;p style=text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size: 9pt;margin:0pt;&gt;
			&amp;nbsp;	&lt;font style=margin:0pt 0pt 8pt;width: 36pt;font-family:Symbol;text-align:left;text-justify:inter-ideograph;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:9pt;;&gt; &amp;#xB7;&lt;/font&gt;
			&lt;/p&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
			&lt;tr&gt;
				&lt;td valign=top style=width:504.00pt;height:27.00pt;padding:0pt;&gt;
			&lt;p style=text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt;margin:0pt;&gt;
				&lt;font style=margin:0pt 0pt 8pt;width: 36pt;font-family:Symbol;text-align:left;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size:9pt;;&gt; &amp;#xB7;&lt;/font&gt;
			&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;We recognized a discrete tax benefit of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$1.2&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; million in the provision for income taxes line item of our consolidated statements of income for year ended December 31
 2017 related to excess tax benefits upon vesting or settlement in that period. &lt;/font&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;overflow: hidden;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
			&lt;p style=text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt;margin:0pt;&gt;
				&lt;font style=margin:0pt 0pt 8pt;width: 36pt;font-family:Symbol;text-align:left;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size:9pt;;&gt; &amp;#xB7;&lt;/font&gt;
			&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;We elected to adopt the cash flow presentation of the excess tax benefits prospectively
 commencing with our consolidated statements of cash flows for the year ended December 31
 2017
 where these benefits are classified along with other income tax cash flows as an operating activity.&lt;/font&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;overflow: hidden;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
			&lt;p style=text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt;margin:0pt;&gt;
				&lt;font style=margin:0pt 0pt 8pt;width: 36pt;font-family:Symbol;text-align:left;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size:9pt;;&gt; &amp;#xB7;&lt;/font&gt;
			&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;We elected to account for forfeitures as they occur to determine the amount of compensation cost to be recognized in each period
 rather than estimating the number of share-based awards expected to vest. &lt;/font&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;overflow: hidden;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
			&lt;p style=text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt;margin:0pt;&gt;
				&lt;font style=margin:0pt 0pt 8pt;width: 36pt;font-family:Symbol;text-align:left;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size:9pt;;&gt; &amp;#xB7;&lt;/font&gt;
			&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;At this time
 we have not changed our policy on statutory withholding requirements and will continue to allow an employee to withhold at the minimum statutory withholding requirements. Amounts paid by us to taxing authorities when directly withholding shares associated with employees&amp;#x2019; income tax withholding obligations are classified as a financing activity in our consolidated statements of cash flows for the years ended December 31
 2017
 2016 and 2015
 respectively. &lt;/font&gt;
					&lt;p style=margin:0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;overflow: hidden;&gt;
						&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
			&lt;p style=text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt;margin:0pt;&gt;
				&lt;font style=margin:0pt 0pt 8pt;width: 36pt;font-family:Symbol;text-align:left;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size:9pt;;&gt; &amp;#xB7;&lt;/font&gt;
			&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;We excluded the excess tax benefits from the assumed proceeds available to repurchase shares in the computation of our diluted earnings per share for the year ended December 31
 2017.&lt;/font&gt;
				&lt;/td&gt;
			&lt;/tr&gt;
		&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;In July 2015
 the FASB issued ASU 2015-11
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-style:italic;color:#000000;&gt;Inventory (Topic 330): Simplifying the Measurement of Inventory&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;This pronouncement changes the measurement principle for certain methods from the lower of cost or net realizable value to the lower of cost and net realizable value.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Net realizable value is defined as the estimated selling price in the ordinary course of business
 less reasonably predictable costs of completion
 disposal and transportation. ASU 2015-11 does not apply to inventory that is measured using the Last-in First-out or the retail inventory method.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The pronouncement is effective for fiscal years beginning after December 15
 2016
 including interim periods within those fiscal years.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The adoption of this new accounting pronouncement did not have a material impact on our financial statements.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;In August 2014
 the FASB issued ASU 2014-15
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-style:italic;color:#000000;&gt;Presentation of Financial Statements &amp;#x2013; Going Concern (Subtopic 205-40): Disclosure of Uncertainties about an Entity&amp;#x2019;s Ability to Continue as a Going Concern
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; which requires management of a company to evaluate whether there is substantial doubt about the company&amp;#x2019;s ability to continue as a going concern. The pronouncement is effective for fiscal years ending after December 15
 2016
 and for interim and annual reporting periods thereafter
 with early adoption permitted.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Company adopted this standard and it had no material impact on the Company&amp;#x2019;s financial statements.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Courier New;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:bold;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Courier New;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:bold;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;&gt;Recently Issued Accounting Pronouncements &amp;#x2013; Pending Adoption&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;We have considered all new accounting pronouncements and have concluded that there are no new pronouncements that may have a material impact on our results of operations
 financial condition
 or cash flows
 based on current information
 except for:&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;In February 2016
 the FASB issued ASU 2016-02
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-style:italic;color:#000000;&gt;Leases (Topic 842)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The objective of this update is to increase transparency and comparability among organizations by recognizing the rights and obligations of all leased assets with a term greater than 12 months to be presented on the balance sheet.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The pronouncement is effective for fiscal years beginning after December 15
 2018
 including interim periods within those annual periods and is to be applied utilizing a modified retrospective approach.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Management is currently evaluating the effect that the provisions of ASU 2016-02 will have on the Company&amp;#x2019;s financial statements.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;In January 2016
 the FASB issued ASU 2016-01
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-style:italic;color:#000000;&gt;Financial Instruments- Overall (Subtopic 825-10): Recognition and Measurement of Financial Assets and Financial Liabilities&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The main objective of this update is to enhance the reporting model for financial instruments to provide users of financial statements with more decision-useful information.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The new guidance addresses certain aspects of recognition
 measurement
 presentation
 and disclosure of financial instruments. Most notably ASU 2016-01 requires the change in fair value of available for sale securities to be recognized in net income.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The pronouncement also requires the use of the exit price notion
 the separate presentation of financial assets and liabilities by measurement category and form of asset
 and the separate presentation in other comprehensive income of changes in fair value resulting from a change in the instrument-specific credit risk.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The pronouncement is effective for fiscal years beginning after December 15
 2017
 including interim periods within those fiscal years.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Based on the risk level of the Company&amp;#x2019;s investment portfolio
 management does not expect the pronouncement to have a material impact on the Company&amp;#x2019;s financial statements.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;As of December 31
 2017
 the Company&amp;#x2019;s unrealized losses on marketable securities
 net of tax included in accumulated other comprehensive loss of the Company&amp;#x2019;s Consolidated Balance Sheets was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$160&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; thousand.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;In May 2014
 the FASB issued ASU 2015-09
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;font-style:italic;color:#000000;&gt;Revenue from Contracts with Customers (Topic 606).&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;The new revenue recognition standard requires the Company to recognize revenue for the transfer of goods or services to customers for the amount the Company expects to be entitled to receive in exchange for those goods or services.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Company will be required to identify the contract
 identify the relevant performance obligations
 determine the transaction price
 allocate the transaction price to the performance obligations in the contract
 and recognize the revenue when the entity satisfies a performance obligation. The new revenue standard is effective for annual reporting periods (including interim reporting periods within those periods) beginning January 1
 2018. Companies have the option of using either a full retrospective or a modified retrospective approach to adopt the guidance. The Company intends to adopt the new standard on a modified retrospective basis.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;On January 1
 2018
 the Company adopted the new revenue standard on a modified retrospective basis and recorded an after-tax transition adjustment to reduce retained earnings as of January 1
 2018 by approximately &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;$2.0&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; million.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;This is comprised of $5.6 million of revenue offset by $3.6 million of inventory costs
 deferred shipping expense
 credit card fees and income taxes.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;The results of ASU 606 primarily impact the Company&amp;#x2019;s timing of revenue recognition for product shipments
 as product revenue will be recognized upon customer receipt in lieu of at the time of shipment.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The new standard will require more extensive revenue-related disclosures.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt; &amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;text-align:left;font-family:Times New Roman;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;color:#000000;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size=1&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  

		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;7.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;EQUITY&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;Issuance of Additional Common Stock&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;On May 18
 2017
 the stockholders of the Company approved the Medifast
 Inc. Amended and Restated 2012 Share Incentive Plan (the &amp;#x201C;Amended and Restated 2012 Plan&amp;#x201D;) that increased the number of shares of the Company&amp;#x2019;s common stock
 par value &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;$.001&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; per share
 that may be awarded under the Amended and Restated 2012 Plan by &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;600
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;
 to an aggregate of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;1
600
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;font-weight:bold;&gt;Stock Repurchase Plan&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;
		&lt;p style=margin:6pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;font-size: 9pt&gt;
			&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;On June 14
 2017
 the Company announced that it had established a stock repurchase plan under Rule 10b-18 of the Securities and Exchange Act of 1934
 as amended (the &amp;#x201C;Stock Repurchase Plan&amp;#x201D;). The Stock Repurchase Plan permits the Company to repurchase up to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;850
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; shares of its common stock until June 30
 2018
 unless the plan is terminated earlier in accordance with its terms.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;There is &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;no&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; guarantee as to the exact number of shares of the Company&amp;#x2019;s common stock
 if any
 that will be repurchased under the Stock Repurchase Plan.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;As of December 31
 2017
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt;no&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=display: inline;&gt; shares have been repurchased by the Company under the Stock Repurchase Plan.&lt;/font&gt;
		&lt;/p&gt;

							function toggleNextSibling (e) {
							if (e.nextSibling.style.display=='none') {
							e.nextSibling.style.display='block';
							} else { e.nextSibling.style.display='none'; }











Dec. 31
 2017
Mar. 05
 2018
Jun. 30
 2017































  2017

































































































Entity Common Stock
 Shares Outstanding



036
811









If the value is true
 then the document is an amendment to previously-filed/accepted document.

























































This is focus fiscal period of the document report. For a first quarter 2006 quarterly report
 which may also provide financial information from prior periods
 the first fiscal quarter should be given as the fiscal period focus. Values: FY
 Q1
 Q2
 Q3
 Q4
 H1
 H2
 M9
 T1
 T2
 T3
 M8
 CY.




























This is focus fiscal year of the document report in CCYY format. For a 2006 annual report
 which may also provide financial information from prior periods
 fiscal 2006 should be given as the fiscal year focus. Example: 2006.




























The end date of the period reflected on the cover page if a periodic report. For all other reports and registration statements containing historical data
 it is the date up through which that historical data is presented.  If there is no historical data in the report
 use the filing date. The format of the date is CCYY-MM-DD.




























The type of document being provided (such as 10-K
 10-Q
 485BPOS
 etc). The document type is limited to the same value as the supporting SEC submission type
 or the word Other.

























































Indicate number of shares or other units outstanding of each of registrant's classes of capital or common stock or other ownership interests
 if and as stated on cover of related periodic report. Where multiple classes or units exist define each class/interest by adding class of stock items such as Common Class A [Member]
 Common Class B [Member] or Partnership Interest [Member] onto the Instrument [Domain] of the Entity Listings
 Instrument.




























Indicate Yes or No whether registrants (1) have filed all reports required to be filed by Section 13 or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 during the preceding 12 months (or for such shorter period that registrants were required to file such reports)
 and (2) have been subject to such filing requirements for the past 90 days. This information should be based on the registrant's current or most recent filing containing the related disclosure.




























Indicate whether the registrant is one of the following: (1) Large Accelerated Filer
 (2) Accelerated Filer
 (3) Non-accelerated Filer
 (4) Smaller Reporting Company (Non-accelerated) or (5) Smaller Reporting Accelerated Filer. Definitions of these categories are stated in Rule 12b-2 of the Exchange Act. This information should be based on the registrant's current or most recent filing containing the related disclosure.




























State aggregate market value of voting and non-voting common equity held by non-affiliates computed by reference to price at which the common equity was last sold
 or average bid and asked price of such common equity
 as of the last business day of registrant's most recently completed second fiscal quarter. The public float should be reported on the cover page of the registrants form 10K.




























The exact name of the entity filing the report as specified in its charter
 which is required by forms filed with the SEC.

























































Indicate Yes or No if the registrant is a well-known seasoned issuer
 as defined in Rule 405 of the Securities Act. Is used on Form Type: 10-K
 10-Q
 8-K
 20-F
 6-K
 10-K/A
 10-Q/A
 20-F/A
 6-K/A
 N-CSR
 N-Q
 N-1A.





































































							function toggleNextSibling (e) {
							if (e.nextSibling.style.display=='none') {

The aggregate total costs related to selling a firm's product and services
 as well as all other general and administrative expenses. Direct selling expenses (for example
 credit
 warranty
 and advertising) are expenses that can be directly linked to the sale of specific products. Indirect selling expenses are expenses that cannot be directly linked to the sale of specific products
 for example telephone expenses
 Internet
 and postal charges. General and administrative expenses include salaries of non-sales personnel
 rent
 utilities
 communication
 etc.

Amount due from customers or clients
 within one year of the balance sheet date (or the normal operating cycle
 whichever is longer)
 for goods or services (including trade receivables) that have been delivered or sold in the normal course of business
 reduced to the estimated net realizable fair value by an allowance established by the entity of the amount it deems uncertain of collection.




























Accumulated change in equity from transactions and other events and circumstances from non-owner sources
 net of tax effect
 at period end. Excludes Net Income (Loss)
 and accumulated changes in equity from transactions resulting from investments by owners and distributions to owners. Includes foreign currency translation items
 certain pension adjustments
 unrealized gains and losses on certain investments in debt and equity securities
 other than temporary impairment (OTTI) losses related to factors other than credit losses on available-for-sale and held-to-maturity debt securities that an entity does not intend to sell and it is not more likely than not that the entity will be required to sell before recovery of the amortized cost basis
 as well as changes in the fair value of derivatives related to the effective portion of a designated cash flow hedge.




























Excess of issue price over par or stated value of the entity's capital stock and amounts received from other transactions involving the entity's stock or stockholders. Includes adjustments to additional paid in capital. Some examples of such adjustments include recording the issuance of debt with a beneficial conversion feature and certain tax consequences of equity instruments awarded to employees. Use this element for the aggregate amount of additional paid-in capital associated with common and preferred stock. For additional paid-in capital associated with only common stock
 use the element additional paid in capital
 common stock. For additional paid-in capital associated with only preferred stock
 use the element additional paid in capital
 preferred stock.

























































Sum of the carrying amounts as of the balance sheet date of all assets that are expected to be realized in cash
 sold
 or consumed within one year (or the normal operating cycle
 if longer). Assets are probable future economic benefits obtained or controlled by an entity as a result of past transactions or events.

 highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates. Includes effect from exchange rate changes.

 Inc. (the &#x201C;Company&#x201D; or &#x201C;Medifast&#x201D;) is a Delaware corporation
 incorporated in 1989. The Company&#x2019;s operations are primarily conducted through its wholly owned subsidiaries
 Jason Pharmaceuticals
 Inc.
VIA
 LLC
 Jason Enterprises
 Inc.
 Jason Properties
 LLC
 Medifast Franchise Systems
 Inc.
 Medifast Nutrition
 Inc.
 Seven Crondall Associates
 LLC
 Performance Products
 LLC
 and Corporate Events
 Inc.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company is a leading manufacturer and distributor of clinically proven healthy living products and programs.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company&#x2019;s product lines include weight loss
 weight management and healthy living meal replacements
 snacks
 hydration products
 and vitamins.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company has one modern
 United States Food and Drug Administration (&#x201C;FDA&#x201D;)-approved manufacturing facility located in Owings Mills

		


 including the internet
 call center
 independent health advisors
 medical professionals
 franchise weight loss clinics
 and direct consumer marketing supported via the phone and internet.&nbsp;&nbsp;The processing
 formulation
 packaging
 labeling and advertising of the Company&#x2019;s products are subject to regulation by one or more federal agencies
 including the FDA
 the Federal Trade Commission (the &#x201C;FTC&#x201D;)
 the Consumer Product Safety Commission
 the United States Department of Agriculture

		
		
	







The entire disclosure for the business description and basis of presentation concepts.  Business description describes the nature and type of organization including but not limited to organizational structure as may be applicable to holding companies
 parent and subsidiary relationships
 business divisions
 business units
 business segments
 affiliates and information about significant ownership of the reporting entity.  Basis of presentation describes the underlying basis used to prepare the financial statements (for example
 US Generally Accepted Accounting Principles
 Other Comprehensive Basis of Accounting
 IFRS).

Cash and cash equivalents consist of cash on deposit in financial institutions

		

 &#x2013; Our cash and cash equivalents and available-for-sale securities are maintained at several financial institutions
 and the balances with these financial institutions often exceed the amount of insurance provided on such accounts by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation. The cash and cash equivalents generally are maintained with financial institutions with reputable credit
 and therefore bear minimal credit risk. Historically

		

Our financial instruments include cash and cash equivalents
 investment in available-for-sale securities
 and trade receivables. The carrying amounts of cash and cash equivalents

		

Accounts receivable are recorded net of reserves for sales returns and allowances

		


 we consider actual return rates in preceding periods. To the extent the estimate of returns changes
 we will adjust the reserve
 which will impact the amount of product sales revenue recognized in the period of the adjustment. Our estimates for returns have not differed materially from our actual returns. The provision for estimated returns as of December 31
 thousand

		


 as well as customer payment history.&nbsp;&nbsp;The allowance for doubtful accounts as of December 31
 thousand

		

Inventories consist principally of packaged meal replacements held in the Company&#x2019;s warehouses.&nbsp;&nbsp;Inventory is stated at the lower of cost or net realizable value
 utilizing the first-in
 first-out method.&nbsp;&nbsp;The cost of finished goods includes the cost of raw materials
 packaging supplies
 direct and indirect labor and other indirect manufacturing costs.&nbsp;&nbsp;On a quarterly basis

		

The Company&#x2019;s investments consist of debt and equity securities classified as available-for-sale securities.&nbsp;&nbsp;Available-for-sale securities are stated at fair value
 and unrealized holding gains and losses
 net of the related deferred tax effect
 are reported as a separate component of accumulated other comprehensive income (loss) in stockholders' equity.&nbsp;&nbsp;Interest and dividends on marketable debt and equity securities are recognized in income when declared. Realized gains and losses
 including losses from declines in value of specific securities determined by management to be other-than-temporary
 if any

		


 Plant
Property

Long-lived assets are reviewed for impairment whenever events or changes in circumstances indicate that the carrying amount of an asset may not be recoverable. Recoverability of assets to be held and used is measured by a comparison of the carrying amount of an asset to estimated undiscounted future cash flows expected to be generated by the asset. If the carrying amount of an asset exceeds its estimated future cash flows
 an impairment charge is recognized by the amount by which the carrying amount of the asset exceeds the fair value of the asset
		

Revenue is recognized net of discounts
 rebates
 promotional adjustments
 price adjustments
 and estimated returns and upon transfer of title and risk to the customer which occurs at shipping (Free On Board terms).&nbsp;&nbsp;Upon shipment

		

- Our shipping and handling costs for shipments of our product to our customers are included in cost of sales. All shipping and handling charges that are billed to customers are included in net revenue. All other shipping and handling costs are included in selling

		

 leases retail stores
 distribution facilities
 and office space under operating leases.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Many of our lease agreements contain tenant improvement allowances
 rent holidays
 rent escalation clauses
 and contingent rent provisions.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company recognizes incentives and minimum rental expenses on a straight-line basis over the terms of the leases.&nbsp;&nbsp;We commence recording rent expense on the date of initial possession
 which is generally when we enter the space and begin to make improvements to properties for our intended use.&nbsp;&nbsp;For tenant improvement allowances and rent holidays

		


 we record minimum rental expenses on a straight-line basis over the terms of the leases on the consolidated statements of income.&nbsp;&nbsp;Several leases provide for contingent rents

		

Advertising costs are expensed as incurred
 except for the preparation
 layout
 design and production of advertising costs which are expensed when the advertisement is first used.&nbsp;&nbsp;Advertising expense for continuing operations
 excluding broker fees
 for the years ended December 31
 2017
 2016
 and 2015
 million
 million
 million

		

The Company incurs research and development costs in connection with the development of new products and programs
 million
 million
 million in research and development expense for the years ended December 31
 2017
 2016
 and 2015

		

 compensation consists primarily of restricted stock awards
 market- and performance-based share awards
 and stock options granted to employees and directors.&nbsp;&nbsp;Restricted stock awards are measured at the grant date
 based on the calculated fair value of the award

		

- Clinic closure costs are expensed and recognized as a liability at their fair value when incurred.&nbsp;&nbsp;One-time employee severance costs are expensed and recognized as a liability when the plan is finalized by management
 approved and committed to by management

		

The benefit of a tax position is recognized in the consolidated financial statements in the period during which
 based on all available evidence
 management believes it is more-likely-than-not that the position will be sustained upon examination
 including the resolution of appeals or litigation processes

		


 2017 and 2016
 no material estimated interest or penalties were recognized for the uncertainty of certain tax positions. We file income tax returns in the United States
 Canada and various states jurisdictions.&nbsp;&nbsp;We are generally no longer subject to United States federal
 state

		


 in the opinion of management

		

			
		

Other comprehensive income refers to revenues
 expenses
 gains and losses that are not included in net income but rather are recorded directly in stockholders&#x2019; equity. Comprehensive income consists of net income
 unrealized gains and losses on available-for-sale securities

		

			
		


 the Financial Accounting Standards Board (the &#x201C;FASB&#x201D;) issued Accounting Standards Update (&#x201C;ASU&#x201D;) 2016-09
 &nbsp;The objective of this update is to simplify several aspects of the accounting for employee share-based payment transactions
 including the income tax consequences
 classifications of awards as either equity or liabilities
 and the classification on the statement of cash flow.&nbsp;&nbsp;The new guidance requires
 among its other provisions
 that excess tax benefits (which represent the excess of actual tax benefits received at the date of vesting or settlement over the benefits recognized over the vesting period or upon issuance of share-based payments) and tax deficiencies (which represent the amount by which actual tax benefits received at the date of vesting or settlement is lower than the benefits recognized over the vesting period or upon issuance of share-based payments) be recorded in the statement of income as an increase or decrease in income taxes when the awards vest or are settled. This is in comparison to the prior requirement that these excess tax benefits be recognized in additional paid-in capital and these tax deficiencies be recognized either as an offset to accumulated excess tax benefits
 if any
 or in the statement of income. The new guidance also requires excess tax benefits to be classified along with other income tax cash flows as an operating activity in the statements of cash flows rather than
 as previously required
 a financing activity.&nbsp;&nbsp;The pronouncement is effective for fiscal years beginning after December 15
 2016
 including interim periods.&nbsp;&nbsp;As such
 the Company adopted this new accounting pronouncement effective January 1

 we have not changed our policy on statutory withholding requirements and will continue to allow an employee to withhold at the minimum statutory withholding requirements.  the FASB issued ASU 2015-11
.&nbsp;&nbsp;This pronouncement changes the measurement principle for certain methods from the lower of cost or net realizable value to the lower of cost and net realizable value.&nbsp;&nbsp;Net realizable value is defined as the estimated selling price in the ordinary course of business
 less reasonably predictable costs of completion
 disposal and transportation. ASU 2015-11 does not apply to inventory that is measured using the Last-in First-out or the retail inventory method.&nbsp;&nbsp;The pronouncement is effective for fiscal years beginning after December 15
 2016

		


 the FASB issued ASU 2014-15
Presentation of Financial Statements &#x2013; Going Concern (Subtopic 205-40): Disclosure of Uncertainties about an Entity&#x2019;s Ability to Continue as a Going Concern
 which requires management of a company to evaluate whether there is substantial doubt about the company&#x2019;s ability to continue as a going concern. The pronouncement is effective for fiscal years ending after December 15
 2016
 and for interim and annual reporting periods thereafter

 or cash flows

 the FASB issued ASU 2016-02
.&nbsp;&nbsp;The objective of this update is to increase transparency and comparability among organizations by recognizing the rights and obligations of all leased assets with a term greater than 12 months to be presented on the balance sheet.&nbsp;&nbsp;The pronouncement is effective for fiscal years beginning after December 15
 2018

		


 the FASB issued ASU 2016-01
.&nbsp;&nbsp;The main objective of this update is to enhance the reporting model for financial instruments to provide users of financial statements with more decision-useful information.&nbsp;&nbsp;The new guidance addresses certain aspects of recognition
 measurement
 presentation
 and disclosure of financial instruments. Most notably ASU 2016-01 requires the change in fair value of available for sale securities to be recognized in net income.&nbsp;&nbsp;The pronouncement also requires the use of the exit price notion
 the separate presentation of financial assets and liabilities by measurement category and form of asset
 and the separate presentation in other comprehensive income of changes in fair value resulting from a change in the instrument-specific credit risk.&nbsp;&nbsp;The pronouncement is effective for fiscal years beginning after December 15
 2017
 including interim periods within those fiscal years.&nbsp;&nbsp;Based on the risk level of the Company&#x2019;s investment portfolio
 management does not expect the pronouncement to have a material impact on the Company&#x2019;s financial statements.&nbsp;&nbsp;As of December 31
 2017
 the Company&#x2019;s unrealized losses on marketable securities
 net of tax included in accumulated other comprehensive loss of the Company&#x2019;s Consolidated Balance Sheets was 
		


 the FASB issued ASU 2015-09
The new revenue recognition standard requires the Company to recognize revenue for the transfer of goods or services to customers for the amount the Company expects to be entitled to receive in exchange for those goods or services.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company will be required to identify the contract
 identify the relevant performance obligations
 determine the transaction price
 allocate the transaction price to the performance obligations in the contract
 and recognize the revenue when the entity satisfies a performance obligation. The new revenue standard is effective for annual reporting periods (including interim reporting periods within those periods) beginning January 1
 2018. Companies have the option of using either a full retrospective or a modified retrospective approach to adopt the guidance. The Company intends to adopt the new standard on a modified retrospective basis.&nbsp;&nbsp;On January 1
 2018
 the Company adopted the new revenue standard on a modified retrospective basis and recorded an after-tax transition adjustment to reduce retained earnings as of January 1
This is comprised of $5.6 million of revenue offset by $3.6 million of inventory costs
 deferred shipping expense
The results of ASU 606 primarily impact the Company&#x2019;s timing of revenue recognition for product shipments
 as product revenue will be recognized upon customer receipt in lieu of at the time of shipment.&nbsp;&nbsp;The new standard will require more extensive revenue-related disclosures.

Cash and cash equivalents consist of cash on deposit in financial institutions

		
		
	






 &#x2013; Our cash and cash equivalents and available-for-sale securities are maintained at several financial institutions
 and the balances with these financial institutions often exceed the amount of insurance provided on such accounts by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation. The cash and cash equivalents generally are maintained with financial institutions with reputable credit
 and therefore bear minimal credit risk. Historically

		
		
	






Our financial instruments include cash and cash equivalents
 investment in available-for-sale securities
 and trade receivables. The carrying amounts of cash and cash equivalents

		
		
	






Accounts receivable are recorded net of reserves for sales returns and allowances

		


 we consider actual return rates in preceding periods. To the extent the estimate of returns changes
 we will adjust the reserve
 which will impact the amount of product sales revenue recognized in the period of the adjustment. Our estimates for returns have not differed materially from our actual returns. The provision for estimated returns as of December 31
 thousand

		


 as well as customer payment history.&nbsp;&nbsp;The allowance for doubtful accounts as of December 31
 thousand

		
		
	






Inventories consist principally of packaged meal replacements held in the Company&#x2019;s warehouses.&nbsp;&nbsp;Inventory is stated at the lower of cost or net realizable value
 utilizing the first-in
 first-out method.&nbsp;&nbsp;The cost of finished goods includes the cost of raw materials
 packaging supplies
 direct and indirect labor and other indirect manufacturing costs.&nbsp;&nbsp;On a quarterly basis

		
		
	






The Company&#x2019;s investments consist of debt and equity securities classified as available-for-sale securities.&nbsp;&nbsp;Available-for-sale securities are stated at fair value
 and unrealized holding gains and losses
 net of the related deferred tax effect
 are reported as a separate component of accumulated other comprehensive income (loss) in stockholders' equity.&nbsp;&nbsp;Interest and dividends on marketable debt and equity securities are recognized in income when declared. Realized gains and losses
 including losses from declines in value of specific securities determined by management to be other-than-temporary
 if any

Long-lived assets are reviewed for impairment whenever events or changes in circumstances indicate that the carrying amount of an asset may not be recoverable. Recoverability of assets to be held and used is measured by a comparison of the carrying amount of an asset to estimated undiscounted future cash flows expected to be generated by the asset. If the carrying amount of an asset exceeds its estimated future cash flows

		
		
	






Revenue is recognized net of discounts
 rebates
 promotional adjustments
 price adjustments
 and estimated returns and upon transfer of title and risk to the customer which occurs at shipping (Free On Board terms).&nbsp;&nbsp;Upon shipment

		
		
	






- Our shipping and handling costs for shipments of our product to our customers are included in cost of sales. All shipping and handling charges that are billed to customers are included in net revenue. All other shipping and handling costs are included in selling

		
		
	






 leases retail stores
 distribution facilities
 and office space under operating leases.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Many of our lease agreements contain tenant improvement allowances
 rent holidays
 rent escalation clauses
 and contingent rent provisions.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company recognizes incentives and minimum rental expenses on a straight-line basis over the terms of the leases.&nbsp;&nbsp;We commence recording rent expense on the date of initial possession
 which is generally when we enter the space and begin to make improvements to properties for our intended use.&nbsp;&nbsp;For tenant improvement allowances and rent holidays

		


 we record minimum rental expenses on a straight-line basis over the terms of the leases on the consolidated statements of income.&nbsp;&nbsp;Several leases provide for contingent rents

 except for the preparation
 layout
 design and production of advertising costs which are expensed when the advertisement is first used.&nbsp;&nbsp;Advertising expense for continuing operations
 excluding broker fees

 compensation consists primarily of restricted stock awards
 market- and performance-based share awards

- Clinic closure costs are expensed and recognized as a liability at their fair value when incurred.&nbsp;&nbsp;One-time employee severance costs are expensed and recognized as a liability when the plan is finalized by management
 approved and committed to by management

		
		
	






The benefit of a tax position is recognized in the consolidated financial statements in the period during which
 based on all available evidence
 management believes it is more-likely-than-not that the position will be sustained upon examination
 including the resolution of appeals or litigation processes

		


 2017 and 2016
 no material estimated interest or penalties were recognized for the uncertainty of certain tax positions. We file income tax returns in the United States
 Canada and various states jurisdictions.&nbsp;&nbsp;We are generally no longer subject to United States federal
 state

Other comprehensive income refers to revenues
 expenses
 gains and losses that are not included in net income but rather are recorded directly in stockholders&#x2019; equity. Comprehensive income consists of net income
 unrealized gains and losses on available-for-sale securities

		
		
	






			
		


 the Financial Accounting Standards Board (the &#x201C;FASB&#x201D;) issued Accounting Standards Update (&#x201C;ASU&#x201D;) 2016-09
 &nbsp;The objective of this update is to simplify several aspects of the accounting for employee share-based payment transactions
 including the income tax consequences
 classifications of awards as either equity or liabilities
 and the classification on the statement of cash flow.&nbsp;&nbsp;The new guidance requires
 among its other provisions
 that excess tax benefits (which represent the excess of actual tax benefits received at the date of vesting or settlement over the benefits recognized over the vesting period or upon issuance of share-based payments) and tax deficiencies (which represent the amount by which actual tax benefits received at the date of vesting or settlement is lower than the benefits recognized over the vesting period or upon issuance of share-based payments) be recorded in the statement of income as an increase or decrease in income taxes when the awards vest or are settled. This is in comparison to the prior requirement that these excess tax benefits be recognized in additional paid-in capital and these tax deficiencies be recognized either as an offset to accumulated excess tax benefits
 if any
 or in the statement of income. The new guidance also requires excess tax benefits to be classified along with other income tax cash flows as an operating activity in the statements of cash flows rather than
 as previously required
 a financing activity.&nbsp;&nbsp;The pronouncement is effective for fiscal years beginning after December 15
 2016
 including interim periods.&nbsp;&nbsp;As such
 the Company adopted this new accounting pronouncement effective January 1

 we have not changed our policy on statutory withholding requirements and will continue to allow an employee to withhold at the minimum statutory withholding requirements.
